intro: Roella incurva var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid roella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, often twisted stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Roella incurva var. rigida is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
